discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think C is correct

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants a list button to display a Visualforce page that allows users to edit multiple records.

Which Visualforce feature supports this requirement?

choices.B: Custom List Controller with recordSetVar page attribute
choices.C: Standard controller and the recordSetVar page attribute
choices.A: Standard Controller with Custom List Controller extension

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
they for sure dont require test classes

Selected Answer: AB
I think A & B are correct
I think A & B are correct

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to assess the advantages of declarative development versus programmatic customization for specific use cases in its Salesforce implementation.

What are two characteristics of declarative development over programmatic customization? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Declarative development does not require Apex test classes.
choices.C: Declarative code logic does not require maintenance or review.
choices.D: Declarative development has higher design limits and query limits.
choices.B: Declarative development can be done using the Setup menu.

questions.question_text: Which two strategies should a developer use to avoid hitting governor limits when developing in a multi-tenant environment? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Use methods from the ג€Limitsג€ class to monitor governor limits.
choices.D: Use variables within Apex classes to store large amounts of data.
choices.C: Use SOQL for loops to iterate data retrieved from queries that return a high number of rows.
choices.A: Use collections to store all fields from a related object and not just minimally required fields.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. bubbles: true, composed: true

Setting bubbles: true allows the event to propagate or bubble up through the DOM, and setting composed: true allows the event to cross the Shadow DOM boundary.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text: Which Lightning Web Component custom event property settings enable the event to bubble up the containment hierarchy and cross the Shadow DOM boundary?

choices.D: JavaScript validation is run in the browser.
choices.B: The original record is loaded from the database.
choices.A: System validation is run for maximum field lengths.
choices.C: Old values are overwritten with the new record values.

questions.question_text:
A developer created a trigger on a custom object. This custom object also has some dependent pick lists.

According to the order of execution rules, which step happens first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A
Before Salesforce executes these events on the server, the browser runs JavaScript validation if the record contains any dependent picklist fields
